Name: Chris Last
Job/Team Function: Responsible for delivering an HR service to the Civil Service’s 400,000+ employees and management. To ensure that the HR service is cost-effective and supports the customer-focused delivery of the Civil Service’s activities, and responsible for HR professional development and for introducing Next Generation HR. The introduction of Next Generation HR allows the HR profession to work together across government, ensuring the delivery of HR services more efficiently and effectively. Also responsible for the HR actions in the Civil Service Reform Plan including implementation of the Capabilities Plan; secondments and interchange; common standards of promotion, improving the modern workplace and employment offer; all contributing to delivering an exceptional civil service that is more skilled, less bureaucratic and more unified.
Notes: Other team costs included here

Name: John Manzoni
Job Title: Chief Executive of the Civil Service
Job/Team Function:
The Chief Executive of the Civil Service is responsible for developing the core corporate functions that make government as a whole work more efficiently and for improving the Civil Service’s ability to deliver. He is responsible for driving the efficiency and reform programme, supporting and challenging departmental Permanent Secretaries to ensure that the government’s priorities are implemented with pace and rigour.
The Chief Executive also supports the Head of the Civil Service in contributing to the corporate leadership of the Civil Service, in particular on Civil Service Reform and delivering the four priorities set out in the Capabilities Plan.
